result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher T Sokolich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher T Sokolich is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher T Sokolich was found guilty of Failure to Support Child (120 Days+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Christopher T Sokolich was found guilty of Failure to Support Child (<120 Days) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).
  • Christopher T Sokolich was found guilty of Failure to Support Child (<120 Days) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).
  • Christopher T Sokolich was found guilty of Failure to Support Child (<120 Days) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Report to DOC within 24 hours.

While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations through the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806

All financial obligations paid through the Clerk of Courts office are subject to civil judgment and certification to the Department of Revenue on any balance owed after 60 days from entry of judgment.

miscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain employment of at least thirty (30) hours per week and if the defendant is not employed, he must do five (5) job searches each week and report the job searches to the Ashland County Child Support Agency as directed by Child Support Agency (i.e. the form or fashion that the Child Support Office requires.)
Def is to undergo counseling for criminal thinking through a Cognitive-Thinking for Change therapy program.

The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!

Maintain at least monthly contact with the Child Support Agency for Ashland County no later than the 5th of each month in the manner as directed by the Child Support Specialist.

Comply with the Child Support Orders.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any  mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Defendant is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold  there.

The Def is to provide a DNA specimen at the Ashland County Jail within 7 days.

Subject to random Testing.

Child Support is to continue to be paid through the Child Support Trust Fund.

Defendant is placed on a payment plan at the rate of $5.00/month through the Clerk of Court's Office.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment within 30 days and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

timeConds.notes: Defenant is granted credit for time served in the amount of 5 days as calculated by the Ashland County Sheriff's Department.

records.addlTxt: See Offer to Settle.  RDK appear, Atty Shawl appears with defendant in peson.  PQ WOR filed.  Offer to Settle represents the agreement of the parties, dated June 6, 2018.  Attached to PQ.  16CF17 Ct #6 amended  Ct #8 charge amended; Ct #9; Ct #10,. 16CF158 Ct #1.  Repeater Status - FBJ - no repeater status.  Please NC to each of the 4 counts. Admits he is a repeater.  16CF17, Ct 7, 11 - Dismissed.  Ct.12 - DRi.  Uncharged FBJ is being read in for sentencing.  If restitution involved court can order restitution to pay.  Court can consider uncharged read ins for purpsoes of sentencing.   Signed PQ and WOR per defendant.  Read over completely, understands, discussed w/atty, no threats, force.  Take prescribed meds under Dr care.  Court accepts pleas and finds guilty.  16CF17 - Counts 6,8,9,10.  As to each count - S/W Probation 3 years with conditions.  (See OTS.)  AODA assmt done within 30 days.  Count #6 - 10 fine plus cc = 567.63;  Count #8,9,10 = mandatory cc and surcharges = 465.15 each count.   DNA spec within 7 days.    CSUP will continue to be pd through child support trust fund; some payment needs to be made  through the COC's fines/costs.  PP set at 5/month.      16CF158 - I/S 180 days jail, CTS 30 days, Consecutive to any other sentence, GT/WR.  If probation revoked in 16CF17  and returns to court for sentencing inat that time court will decide whether that sentence runs conseuctive to or concurrently with 16CF158. (see OTS)  AODA within 30 days.  10 fine/costs = 567.63; DNA Spec within 7 days at ACJ.  No Gun/No Vote.
Copy of Subpoena and requested financial information from Def's employment (sealed)

Defendant Christopher T Sokolich in court with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def failed to appear on last STC, WARRANTS CANCELLED. JT's are set. Def had no idea that he had a court date. His sister had gotten a letter that she could be responsible for bail. Def was here in court when court date was given. Joanne Peterson (def's mother) comments- shares mailbox with def. State comments - some development in case. periods of time in the information, where the def was in jail. Counts would be amended to mism. Counts 6,7,8. May be further amendments  to other counts. Could have an impact. Not at a point to resolve the case, but does not want to call this case off.  Atty comments-- Def's testimony where he was at that time. Asking Def to complete the release of information. Does not need 2 days. On for trial. Def needs to be in Court room at 8:30am. Warrants cancelled. State asking for a modification of bail. Has another fail to appear, Prior record, Asking for cash bail. Atty comments- does not think Cash bail is right, def wants to take care of case. Ct reinstate the bail, might forf a part of his bail as a penalty. be here in 2 days at 8:30 am.

If def has not made contact JT will come off. Atty will consider withdrawing.  Status conference scheduled for June 4, 2018 at 03:30 pm.

Atty Shawl comments on reason for missed court appearance, missed appearance for disability hearing if misses another hearing will be dismissed, intension if grants SB agrees to condition of remaining in Ashland Co, will reside with girlfirend or sisters, will continue AA, the rest is contained in motion. 
ADA state opposes motion to modify to SB, missed court appearances, record of nonappearance cash bail appropriate. 
Atty Shawl no notice yet of next hearing, notice will be sent to the Superior vet services office. 
Ct $500 cash is not unreasonable, but is it neccessary, Ct denies motion to modify today Ct is looking for affidavit from someone saying that def can stay with them, will cosign bond will get def to court on time will face financial penalty if def does not appr.Conditions stay in ashland co, check in periodically, absol, active in counseling or treatment. $500 in full force and effect.
